ja21mia: Fat shaming is wrong but because this is such an emotional personal topic for many, giving the hard facts appear to be taken as shaming and right away dismissed because people are too sensitive to the truth. The author tried to bring metabolism into it by saying it can slow down when you lose weight, body fat, etc but made it seem as thats the end of it. Metabolism is obviously not stationary, it can go up/down based on diet, exercise, environment, etc. Which is why you adjudt accordingly. Thyroid and other medical problems aren’t to blame in most people, lifestyle is. For those who do have medical issues, there are also ways to adjust your lifestyle to minimize its dangers.

mandaroniii: Thank you so much for posting this and sharing your story. I cried both sad and angry tears reading this. It feels nice to know I'm not alone but I wouldn't wish such mistreatment on anyone. If I had a dollar for every time I was mistreated by a doctor, including a time where I confessed suicidal thoughts and was told "lose weight, you'll be light and those feelings will go away", I'd be rich! I never seek medical attention now unless it's something so severe I need to go to the hospital. I had a panic attack earlier this week because I thought I had strep throat and would need to see a doctor. Nobody should ever have to feel that way.

hiphipmurray: This article just validated everything I’ve every experienced. I once had a doctor diagnose me with PCOS with no symptoms, just to give me a PCOS medication that caused weight loss. My now gynecologist was shocked when I said I had been diagnosed with it by this “doctor” because I had none of the typical symptoms. My eating disorders destroyed my digestive system but everyone including doctors thought I was fine because I ‘look so great!’. People need to understand that everyone’s concern with our weight is hurting us in more ways they can imagine and damaging our health more than the few extra pounds. Thanks so much for sharing your story for this article, and every other day on here. Instagrammers like you are the absolutely #1 reason I was able to accept myself. And now I’m so much healthier and happier.

girlletgo: “I demand respect because the lack of it almost killed me.” You inspire me Every. Damn. Day. I love you so much. It’s inspiring to see how the simple act of loving oneself can radiate so many ripples of love to those around you. You are a force my dear sister ❤️

nicolecmaple: The article was amazing, you're amazing! Thank you for being such a light!
raeraefawn: This article rocked my world today. I'm still stunned. I feel like I have options other than trying to change myself. I am tired of decades of trying to fit myself into a perfect package. ginnyatchison: ❤You ARE brave and the respect you demand is absolutely valid in my humble opinion 💓 As I know, being fat is exhausting, all-consuming. But one thing I've come to realise, mainly amongst the online community of other fatties, such as myself, is that we are probably the least demanding humans out there. WHY?..because all we ever wanted was to 'blend in'. To go about our business without feeling somehow, that we are different. We didn't ask to be challenged, we don't ask to be treated any differently, but we are. Society got out of hand, it collectively intimidated us. Our eating disorders and other complex mental 'unwellness' was and is a reflection of how we are often screaming inside because we detest ourselves on the outside. But, little by little, because of strong humans such as you and many others in our community, we are breaking down the barriers and allowing self-love and a confidence we never thought we had, to shout out to the world that it doesn't f***ing matter what size we are, we are ALL beautiful. We are ALL fabulous and we ALL want to just live a happy life, free from judgement and stigma. It really is that simple! 💪👭👬👫❤💗❤💗
